sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: This plugin allows for the builder to add new races or subraces and define many traits for the races via 2da entry or scripting. This plugin also applies effects, and weapon properties, versus a parent race to effect a child race, as well as effects vs that specific child race.

sect1.title: Environmental Variables
sect1.para: NWNX_RACE_SHOW_EFFECT_ICON - Helpful when debugging, this shows the effect's icon (the red and green squares). Some builders may even wish this permanently.

listitem.para: NWNX_SkillRanks - Needed if you're modifying skill ranks.
NWNX_Util - Needed if you're using the 2da method which requires new NWNX_Util_Get2DARowCount().

sect1.title: Setup
sect1.para: Adding new races is beyond the scope of this documentation. The builder should know how to add new races by adding a new entry in the racialtypes.2da as well as adding the appropriate TLK reference identifiers for that new race then adjusting the appropriate columns for their race, including the Ability Score modifications.
The NWNX Race plugin does not provide modifications to ability scores, use the racialtypes.2da columns for changing those.

sect2.title: The 2da Method
sect2.para: To use the 2da method, the builder must create a new column at the end of the racialtypes.2da named RacialModsTable. This column should then be populated with a string value that references another 2da file in which we will define our racial modifiers. Once that is done the builder needs to include nwnx_race_2da and make sure to run NWNX_Race_LoadRacialModifiers() in their OnModuleLoad script.
For example, we've inserted a new race called Aasimar into racialtypes.2da at line 150. In the RacialModsTable column we enter RACEMOD_AASIMAR (Remember maximum 16 characters, case insensitive)

sect2.title: The Scripting Method
sect2.para: The scripting method involves running a command for each race and each modifier OnModuleLoad.

sect2.title: AB
sect2.para: The AB entry is used to modify an attack bonus for a race. Note: this is not a change to the base attack bonus, it's added on top of that.

sect2.title: ABVSRACE
sect2.para: The ABVSRACE entry is used to modify the attack bonus for a race versus another specific race.

sect2.title: AC
sect2.para: The AC entry is used to modify the base AC for a race.

sect2.title: ACVSRACE
sect2.para: The ACVSRACE entry is used to modify the base AC for a race versus another specific race.

sect2.title: CONCEALMENT
sect2.para: The CONCEALMENT entry is used to grant an inate concealment to a race.

sect2.title: DMGREDUCTION
sect2.para: The DMGREDUCTION entry gives an inate damage reduction

sect2.title: DMGRESIST
sect2.para: The DMGRESIST entry gives an inate resistance to damage types

listitem.para: Param1 = The damage type, can be a single Damage Type integer or multiple Damage Type integers summed. You can also just do each on its own line if you'd prefer. Hex can be used for the scripting method if preferred.

sect2.title: DMGIMMUNITY
sect2.para: The DMGIMMUNITY entry gives an inate immunity to damage types

listitem.para: Param1 = The damage type, can be a single Damage Type integer or multiple Damage Type integers summed. You can also just do each on its own line if you'd prefer. Hex can be used for the scripting method if preferred.

sect2.title: FEAT
sect2.para: The FEAT entry awards a feat at a specified level. This feat is awarded after the creature levels up. Level 1 feats can still be added using the FeatsTable column of the racialtypes.2da.

listitem.para: Param2 = The level to grant the feat

sect2.title: FEATUSAGE
sect2.para: The FEATUSAGE controls the amount of usages a race will have based upon their character level for a custom feat they are granted.

listitem.para: Param2 = Usages a day granted at character creation
Param3 = Additional usages a day granted for this many levels

sect2.title: IMMUNITY
sect2.para: The IMMUNITY entry is used to grant the race a total immunity to a variety of effects.

sect2.title: INITIATIVE
sect2.para: The INITIATIVE entry is used to modify the initiative check.

sect2.title: MOVEMENTSPEED
sect2.para: The MOVEMENTSPEED can modify the speed at which the race moves by default.

listitem.para: Param1 = The percentage change to their speed (-99/+99)

sect2.title: RACE
sect2.para: The RACE entry is used when the race the builder is adding has a parent race with which to inherit some hard coded checks. For example, a Ghostwise Halfling would have its RACE set as 3 representing the Halfling race and in turn a player with that race would have an additional +1 to ranged attacks as is set for the Halfling race.

sect2.title: REGENERATION
sect2.para: The REGENERATION entry is used to grant the race an inate regeneration.

listitem.para: Param1 = How many hitpoints to increase (+)
Param2 = How often in seconds to increase the hitpoints (+)

sect2.title: SAVE
sect2.para: The SAVE entry is used to modify base save values.

listitem.para: Param1 = 0-3 meaning SAVING_THROW_ALL, SAVING_THROW_FORT, SAVING_THROW_REFLEX or SAVING_THROW_WILL

sect2.title: SAVEVSRACE
sect2.para: The SAVEVSRACE entry is used to modify base save values vs a specific race. Param1 is the Save constant ID and param2 is the target race constant ID and param3 is the modifier.

listitem.para: Param1 = 0-3 meaning SAVING_THROW_ALL, SAVING_THROW_FORT, SAVING_THROW_REFLEX or SAVING_THROW_WILL

sect2.title: SAVEVSTYPE
sect2.para: The SAVEVSTYPE entry is used to modify base save values vs a specific type. Param1 is the Save constant ID and param2 is the Saving Throw Type constant ID and param3 is the modifier.

listitem.para: Param1 = 0-3 meaning SAVING_THROW_ALL, SAVING_THROW_FORT, SAVING_THROW_REFLEX or SAVING_THROW_WILL

sect2.title: SKILL
sect2.para: The SKILL entry is used to modify base skill ranks. Note: This requires the NWNX_SkillRanks plugin.

sect2.title: SPELLIMMUNITY
sect2.para: The SPELLIMMUNITY entry is used to grant the race a total immunity to specific spells. Note: Only spells that can be resisted can have immunities.

listitem.para: Param1 = The spell row from spells.2da

sect2.title: SRCHARGEN
sect2.para: The SRCHARGEN entry is used to award the race a default spell resistance on character creation.

listitem.para: Param2 (Optional) = Maximum value all Spell Resistance racial values can reach

sect2.title: SRINCLEVEL
sect2.para: The SRINCLEVEL entry is used to award a spell resistance racial bonus as the creature's level increases.

listitem.para: Param1 = Amount of points to increment (+)
Param3 = Level at which the incremental gains begin (+)
